thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Monday, 22 Jan 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: Brazil private-sector pension system deficit up 22 pct in 2017

author: Reuters Editorial
title: Brazil private-sector pension system deficit up 22 pct in 2017
text:
BRASILIA, Jan 22 (Reuters) - Brazilâ€™s state pension system for private-sector workers ended 2017 with a 182.45 billion real ($57.2 billion) deficit, a 22 percent increase from the year before, government data showed on Monday.
The pension system covering public-sector workers and the army, which offers heftier benefits, rose 12 percent to 86.3 billion reais, the government said.
$1 = 3.1873 reais Reporting by Marcela Ayres; Writing by Bruno Federowski Editing by Chizu Nomiyama
